title: @RiotRepertoir Whats the thinking behind over buffing/compensating zed but nerfing talon ?
body:
Is it just champions' popularity ?
Zed is getting buffed patch after patch, and even after the duskblade nerfs he is still overcompensated.
On the other hand, talon's compensation for the above nerf was clearly not enough, and despite Riot saying in previous patches talon is in a bad state in mid lane and definitely needs some buffs, despite the mr buff, the passive/r buff, and the ignite buff, (all small buffs), the duskblade nerf was still stronger and he is even weaker than before now.

Going to cite win rate numbers here because that seems to be what this is about. Do correct me if that's not it. This is based on early data on the 8.6 patch, at what our data analysts consider to be reasonable sample size.

Talon: +0.9% WR
Zed: +0.2% WR

Based on that, it doesn't seem like Talon was nerfed, and if the argument is that the data is off and he was, in fact, nerfed, it seems like it wasn't by much. Zed, on the other had, suffered a nerf component to his compensation package for fear that his Duskblade comp was overdoing it while being directionally correct, so when the numbers came back and it looked like he wasn't overcomped, I felt comfortable taking that precautionary nerf away, which is what is planned for 8.7.
